member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.DeviceType
member.summary: An enum for the different device types supported by the Irrlicht Engine.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.DeviceType.Best
member.summary:
This selection allows Irrlicht to choose the best device from the ones available.
If this selection is chosen then Irrlicht will try to use the IrrlichtDevice native to your operating system. If this is unavailable then the X11, SDL and then console device will be tried. This ensures that Irrlicht will run even if your platform is unsupported, although it may not be able to render anything.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.DeviceType.Console
member.summary:
A simple text only device supported by all platforms.
This device allows applications to run from the command line without opening a window. It can render the output of the software drivers to the console as ASCII. It only supports mouse and keyboard in Windows operating systems.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.DeviceType.FrameBuffer
member.summary:
A device for raw framebuffer access.
Best used with embedded devices and mobile systems. Does not need X11 or other graphical subsystems. May support hw-acceleration via OpenGL-ES for FBDirect.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.DeviceType.OSX
member.summary:
A device native to Mac OSX.
This device uses Apple's Cocoa API and works in Mac OSX 10.2 and above.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.DeviceType.SDL
member.summary:
A device which uses Simple DirectMedia Layer.
The SDL device works under all platforms supported by SDL.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.DeviceType.Win32
member.summary:
A device native to Microsoft Windows.
This device uses the Win32 API and works in all versions of Windows.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.DeviceType.WinCE
member.summary:
A device native to Windows CE devices.
This device works on Windows Mobile, Pocket PC and Microsoft SmartPhone devices.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.DeviceType.X11
member.summary:
A device native to Unix style operating systems.
This device uses the X11 windowing system and works in Linux, Solaris, FreeBSD, OSX and other operating systems which support X11.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.EventType
member.summary: Enumeration for all event types there are.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.EventType.GUI
member.summary:
An event of the graphical user interface.
GUI events are created by the GUI environment or the GUI elements in response to mouse or keyboard events. When a GUI element receives an event it will either process it and return true, or pass the event to its parent. If an event is not absorbed before it reaches the root element then it will then be passed to the user receiver.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.EventType.Joystick
member.summary:
A joystick (joypad, gamepad) input event. You should call IrrlichtDevice.ActivateJoysticks() in order to start receive events of this type.
Joystick events are created by polling all connected joysticks once per device Run() and then passing the events to IrrlichtDevice.PostEvent(). They take the same path as mouse events.
Windows, SDL: Implemented. Linux: Implemented, with POV hat issues. MacOS / Other: Not yet implemented.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.EventType.Key
member.summary:
A key input event.
Like mouse events, keyboard events are created by the device and passed to IrrlichtDevice.PostEvent(). They take the same path as mouse events.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.EventType.Log
member.summary:
A log event.
Log events are only passed to the user receiver if there is one. If they are absorbed by the user receiver then no text will be sent to the console.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.EventType.Mouse
member.summary:
A mouse input event.
Mouse events are created by the device and passed to IrrlichtDevice.PostEvent() in response to mouse input received from the operating system. Mouse events are first passed to the user receiver, then to the GUI environment and its elements, then finally the input receiving scene manager where it is passed to the active camera.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.EventType.User
member.summary:
A user event with user data.
This is not used by Irrlicht and can be used to send user specific data though the system.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters
member.summary: Advanced Irrlicht Device creation parameters. Used as argument for IrrlichtDevice.CreateDevice() method.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.AlphaChannel
member.summary:
Whether the main framebuffer uses an alpha channel.
In some situations it might be desireable to get a color buffer with an alpha channel, e.g. when rendering into a transparent window or overlay. If this flag is set the device tries to create a framebuffer with alpha channel. If this flag is set, only color buffers with alpha channel are considered. Otherwise, it depends on the actual hardware if the colorbuffer has an alpha channel or not.
Default value: false.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.AntiAliasing
member.summary:
Specifies if the device should use fullscreen anti aliasing.
Makes sharp/pixelated edges softer, but requires more performance. Also, 2D elements might look blurred with this switched on. The resulting rendering quality also depends on the hardware and driver you are using, your program might look different on different hardware with this. So if you are writing a game/application with AntiAlias switched on, it would be a good idea to make it possible to switch this option off again by the user. The value is the maximal antialiasing factor requested for the device. The cretion method will automatically try smaller values if no window can be created with the given value. Value one is usually the same as 0 (disabled), but might be a special value on some platforms. On D3D devices it maps to NONMASKABLE.
Default value: 0 (disabled).

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.BitsPerPixel
member.summary:
Minimum Bits per pixel of the color buffer in fullscreen mode. Ignored if windowed mode.
Default value: 16.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.DeviceType
member.summary:
Type of the device.
This setting decides the windowing system used by the device, most device types are native to a specific operating system and so may not be available. DeviceType.Win32 is only available on Windows desktops, DeviceType.WinCE is only available on Windows mobile devices, DeviceType.COCOA is only available on Mac OSX, DeviceType.X11 is available on Linux, Solaris, BSD and other operating systems which use X11, DeviceType.SDL is available on most systems if compiled in, DeviceType.Console is usually available but can only render to text, DeviceType.Best will select the best available device for your operating system.
Default value: DeviceType.Best.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.DoubleBuffer
member.summary:
Whether the main framebuffer uses doublebuffering.
This should be usually enabled, in order to avoid render artifacts on the visible framebuffer. However, it might be useful to use only one buffer on very small devices. If no doublebuffering is available, the drivers will fall back to single buffers.
Default value: true.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.DriverMultithreaded
member.summary:
Driver should be multithreaded.
Enabling this can slow down your application. Note that this does _not_ make Irrlicht threadsafe, but only the underlying driver-API for the graphiccard. So far only supported on D3D.
Default value: false.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.DriverType
member.summary:
Type of video driver used to render graphics.
Default value: DriverType.Software.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.Fullscreen
member.summary:
Should be set to true if the device should run in fullscreen.
Otherwise the device runs in windowed mode.
Default: false.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.HandleSRGB
member.summary:
Flag to enable proper sRGB and linear color handling.
In most situations, it is desireable to have the color handling in non-linear sRGB color space, and only do the intermediate color calculations in linear RGB space. If this flag is enabled, the device and driver try to assure that all color input and output are color corrected and only the internal color representation is linear. This means, that the color output is properly gamma-adjusted to provide the brighter colors for monitor display. And that blending and lighting give a more natural look, due to proper conversion from non-linear colors into linear color space for blend operations. If this flag is enabled, all texture colors (which are usually in sRGB space) are correctly displayed. However vertex colors and other explicitly set values have to be manually encoded in linear color space.
Default: false.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.HighPrecisionFPU
member.summary:
Specifies if the device should use high precision FPU setting.
This is only relevant for DirectX devices, which switch to low FPU precision by default for performance reasons. However, this may lead to problems with the other computations of the application. In this case setting this flag to true should help on the expense of performance loss, though.
Default value: false.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.IgnoreInput
member.summary:
Specifies if the device should ignore input events.
This is only relevant when using external I/O handlers. External windows need to take care of this themselves. Currently only supported by X11.
Default value: false.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a IrrlichtCreationParameters instance with default values.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.LoggingLevel
member.summary:
Specifies the logging level used in the logging interface.
You can access the Logger later on from the IrrlichtDevice.Logger property and set another level. But if you need more or less logging information already from device creation, then you have to change it here.
Default value: LogLevel.Information for Release buid and LogLevel.Debug for Debug build.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.StencilBuffer
member.summary:
Specifies if the stencil buffer should be enabled.
Set this to true, if you want the engine be able to draw stencil buffer shadows. Note that not all drivers are able to use the stencil buffer, hence it can be ignored during device creation. Without the stencil buffer no shadows will be drawn.
Default value: false.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.StereoBuffer
member.summary:
Specifies if the device should use stereo buffers.
Some high-end gfx cards support two framebuffers for direct support of stereoscopic output devices. If this flag is set the device tries to create a stereo context. Currently only supported by OpenGL.
Default value: false.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.UsePerformanceTimer
member.summary:
Enables use of high performance timers on Windows platform. When performance timers are not used, standard GetTickCount() is used instead which usually has worse resolution, but also less problems with speed stepping and other techniques.
Default value: true.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.VSync
member.summary:
Specifies vertical syncronisation.
If set to true, the driver will wait for the vertical retrace period, otherwise not. May be silently ignored.
Default value: false.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.WindowID
member.summary:
Window ID.
If this is set to a value other than 0, the Irrlicht Engine will be created in an already existing window. For windows, set this to the HWND of the window you want. The windowSize and FullScreen options will be ignored when using the WindowID parameter. To make Irrlicht run inside the custom window, you still will have to draw Irrlicht on your own.
Default value: IntPtr.Zero (use own window).

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.WindowSize
member.summary:
Size of the window or the video mode in fullscreen mode.
Default value: 800 x 600.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtCreationParameters.ZBufferBits
member.summary:
Minimum bits per pixel of the depth buffer.
Default value: 16.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice
member.summary:
The Irrlicht device. You can create it with CreateDevice().
This is the most important class of the Irrlicht Engine. You can access everything in the engine if you have a pointer to an instance of this class. There should be only one instance of this class at any time.

member.returns: Created IrrlichtDevice or null if the device could not be created.

member.summary:
Check if a driver type is supported by the engine.
Even if true is returned the driver may not be available for a configuration requested when creating the device.
member.param: Driver type to check.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.ActivateJoysticks
member.summary:
Activates all joysticks found, and returns list of them.
Irrlicht contains support for joysticks, but does not generate joystick events by default, as this would consume joystick info that 3rd party libraries might rely on. Call this method to activate joystick support in Irrlicht and to receive events.
member.returns: Returns list joysticks that were found and activated or null on error.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.EventHandler
member.summary:
Called if an event happened.
Please take care that you should only return 'true' when you want to _prevent_ Irrlicht from processing the event any further. So 'true' does mean that an event is completely done. Therefore your return value for all unprocessed events should be 'false'.
member.param: Event details.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.MinimizeWindow
member.summary: Minimizes the window if possible.

member.name: E:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.OnEvent
member.summary:
Called if an event happened.
Raises for each event from the engine.
You should return true if you have handled the event, and false -- if not (in this case Irrlicht Engine will process it).

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.OSOperator
member.summary:
Provides access to the operation system functionality.
The OS operator provides methods for getting system specific informations and doing system specific operations, such as exchanging data with the clipboard or reading the operation system version.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.PostEvent(IrrlichtLime.Event)
member.summary:
Sends a user created event to the engine.
Is is usually not necessary to use this. However, if you are using an own input library for example for doing joystick input, you can use this to post key or mouse input events to the engine. Internally, this method only delegates the events further to the scene manager and the GUI environment.
member.param: Event to post.
member.returns: True if event has been handled.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.Randomizer
member.summary: Provides access to the engine's currently set randomizer.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.RestoreWindow
member.summary: Restore the window to normal size if possible.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.Run
member.summary:
Runs the device.
Also increments the virtual timer by calling Timer.Tick(). You can prevent this by calling Timer.Stop() before and Timer.Start() after calling IrrlichtDevice.Run(). Returns false if device wants to be deleted.
Note if you are running Irrlicht inside an external, custom created window calling device.Run() will cause Irrlicht to dispatch windows messages internally. If you are running Irrlicht in your own custom window, you can also simply use your own message loop using GetMessage, DispatchMessage and whatever and simply don't use this method. But note that Irrlicht will not be able to fetch user input then. See IrrlichtCreationParameters.WindowID for more information.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.SceneManager
member.summary: Provides access to the scene manager.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.SetGammaRamp(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the current gamma value for the display.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.SetInputReceivingSceneManager(IrrlichtLime.Scene.SceneManager)
member.summary: Sets the input receiving scene manager. If set to null, the main scene manager (returned by SceneManager property) will receive the input.
member.param: New scene manager to be used.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.SetWindowCaption(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the caption of the window.
member.param: New text of the window caption.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.SetWindowResizable(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets if the window should be resizable in windowed mode. This method only works in windowed mode.
Default value: false.
member.param: Flag whether the window should be resizable.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.Sleep(System.Int32)
member.summary: Pause execution and let other processes to run for a specified amount of time. It may not wait the full given time, as sleep may be interrupted.
member.param: Time to sleep for in milisecs.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.Sleep(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pause execution and let other processes to run for a specified amount of time. It may not wait the full given time, as sleep may be interrupted.
member.param: Time to sleep for in milisecs.
If true, pauses the device timer while sleeping.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.IrrlichtDevice.Timer
member.summary: Provides access to the engine's timer. The system time can be retrieved by it as well as the virtual time, which also can be manipulated.

There is no need to start up an Irrlicht Device with Direct3D, OpenGL or Software driver: you can use Null device for this property to use.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.Logger
member.summary: Class for logging messages, warnings and errors.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Logger.Log(System.String)
member.summary: Prints out a text into the log.
member.param: Text to print out.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Logger.Log(System.String,System.String,IrrlichtLime.LogLevel)
member.summary: Prints out a text into the log.
member.param: Text to print out.
Additional info. This string is added after a " :" to the string.
Log level of the text. Texts are filtered using this level. If you want to be a text displayed, independent on what level filter is set, use LogLovel.None.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Logger.Log(System.String,IrrlichtLime.LogLevel)
member.summary: Prints out a text into the log.
member.param: Text to print out.
Log level of the text. Texts are filtered using this level. If you want to be a text displayed, independent on what level filter is set, use LogLovel.None.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Logger.LogLevel
member.summary:
Current log level. With this value, texts which are sent to the logger are filtered out.
Default value: LogLevel.Warning.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.LogLevel
member.summary: Possible log levels.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.LogLevel.Debug
member.summary: Used for printing information helpful in debugging.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.LogLevel.Error
member.summary: Low log level, only errors are printed into the log.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.LogLevel.Information
member.summary: High log level, warnings, errors and important information texts are printed out.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.LogLevel.None
member.summary: Nothing is printed out to the log.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.LogLevel.Warning
member.summary: Default log level, warnings and errors are printed out.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.ReferenceCounted
member.summary:
Base class of most objects of the Irrlicht Engine.
This class provides reference counting through the methods Grab() and Drop(). It also is able to store a debug string for every instance of an object. Most objects of the Irrlicht Engine are derived from ReferenceCounted, and so they are reference counted.
When you create an object in the Irrlicht Engine, calling a method which starts with 'create', an object is created, and you get a pointer to the new object. If you no longer need the object, you have to call Drop(). This will destroy the object, if Grab() was not called in another part of you program, because this part still needs the object. Note, that you only need to call Drop() to the object, if you created it, and the method name starts with 'create'.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.ReferenceCounted.DebugName
member.summary: The debug name of the object. This value may only be set and changed by the object itself. This property has value only when used in Debug mode.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.ReferenceCounted.Drop
member.summary:
Drops the object. Decrements the reference counter by one.
The ReferenceCounted class provides a basic reference counting mechanism with its methods Grab() and Drop(). Most objects of the Irrlicht Engine are derived from ReferenceCounted, and so they are reference counted.
When you create an object in the Irrlicht Engine, calling a method which starts with 'create', an object is created, and you get a pointer to the new object. If you no longer need the object, you have to call Drop(). This will destroy the object, if Grab() was not called in another part of you program, because this part still needs the object. Note, that you only need to call Drop() to the object, if you created it, and the method name starts with 'create'.
member.returns: True, if the object was deleted.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.ReferenceCounted.Grab
member.summary:
Grabs the object. Increments the reference counter by one.
Someone who calls Grab() to an object, should later also call Drop() to it. If an object never gets as much Drop() as Grab() calls, it will never be destroyed.
The ReferenceCounted class provides a basic reference counting mechanism with its methods Grab() and Drop(). Most objects of the Irrlicht Engine are derived from ReferenceCounted, and so they are reference counted.
When you create an object in the Irrlicht Engine, calling a method which starts with 'create', an object is created, and you get a pointer to the new object. If you no longer need the object, you have to call Drop(). This will destroy the object, if Grab() was not called in another part of you program, because this part still needs the object. Note, that you only need to call Drop() to the object, if you created it, and the method name starts with 'create'.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.ReferenceCounted.ReferenceCount
member.summary: Current value of the reference counter.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.Timer
member.summary: Class for getting and manipulating the virtual time.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Timer.IsStopped
member.summary: Returns if the virtual timer is currently stopped.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Timer.RealTime
member.summary:
Current real time in milliseconds of the system.
This value does not start with 0 when the application starts. For example in one implementation the value returned could be the amount of milliseconds which have elapsed since the system was started.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Timer.RealTimeAndDate
member.summary: Current real date and time.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.Timer.RealTimeDate
member.summary: Date and time.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Timer.RealTimeDate.Day
member.summary: Day of the month, from 1 to 31.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Timer.RealTimeDate.DayOfWeek
member.summary: Day of the week for the current day.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Timer.RealTimeDate.DayOfYear
member.summary: Day of the year, from 1 to 366.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Timer.RealTimeDate.Hour
member.summary: Hour of the day, from 0 to 23.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Timer.RealTimeDate.IsDST
member.summary: Whether daylight saving is on.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Timer.RealTimeDate.Minute
member.summary: Minute of the hour, from 0 to 59.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Timer.RealTimeDate.Month
member.summary: Month of the year, from 1 to 12.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Timer.RealTimeDate.Second
member.summary: Second of the minute, due to extra seconds from 0 to 61.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Timer.RealTimeDate.Year
member.summary: Year of the gregorian calender.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Timer.Speed
member.summary:
Speed of the timer.
The speed is the factor with which the time is running faster or slower then the real system time.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Timer.Start
member.summary:
Starts the virtual timer.
The timer is reference counted, which means everything which calls Stop() will also have to call Start(), otherwise the timer may not start/stop correctly again.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Timer.Stop
member.summary:
Stops the virtual timer.
The timer is reference counted, which means everything which calls Stop() will also have to call Start(), otherwise the timer may not start/stop correctly again.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Timer.Tick
member.summary:
Advances the virtual time.
Makes the virtual timer update the time value based on the real time. This is called automatically when calling IrrlichtDevice.Run(), but you can call it manually if you don't use this method.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Timer.Time
member.summary:
Current virtual time in milliseconds.
This value starts with 0 and can be manipulated: value can be set, you can call Start() or Stop() or change Speed. If you need the system time, use RealTime.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Dimension2Dd.GetOptimalSize
member.summary:
Get the optimal size according to some properties.
This is a function often used for texture dimension calculations. The function returns the next larger or smaller dimension which is a power-of-two dimension (2^n,2^m) and/or square (Width=Height).
member.returns: The optimal dimension under the given constraints.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Dimension2Dd.GetOptimalSize(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Get the optimal size according to some properties.
This is a function often used for texture dimension calculations. The function returns the next larger or smaller dimension which is a power-of-two dimension (2^n,2^m) and/or square (Width=Height).
member.param: Forces the result to use only powers of two as values. Default: true.
member.returns: The optimal dimension under the given constraints.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Dimension2Dd.GetOptimalSize(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Get the optimal size according to some properties.
This is a function often used for texture dimension calculations. The function returns the next larger or smaller dimension which is a power-of-two dimension (2^n,2^m) and/or square (Width=Height).
member.param: Forces the result to use only powers of two as values. Default: true.
Makes width==height in the result. Default: false.
member.returns: The optimal dimension under the given constraints.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Dimension2Dd.GetOptimalSize(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Get the optimal size according to some properties.
This is a function often used for texture dimension calculations. The function returns the next larger or smaller dimension which is a power-of-two dimension (2^n,2^m) and/or square (Width=Height).
member.param: Forces the result to use only powers of two as values. Default: true.
Makes width==height in the result. Default: false.
Choose whether the result is larger or smaller than the current dimension. If one dimension need not be changed it is kept with any value of larger. Default: true.
member.returns: The optimal dimension under the given constraints.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Dimension2Dd.GetOptimalSize(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Get the optimal size according to some properties.
This is a function often used for texture dimension calculations. The function returns the next larger or smaller dimension which is a power-of-two dimension (2^n,2^m) and/or square (Width=Height).
member.param: Forces the result to use only powers of two as values. Default: true.
Makes width==height in the result. Default: false.
Choose whether the result is larger or smaller than the current dimension. If one dimension need not be changed it is kept with any value of larger. Default: true.
Maximum texturesize. if value > 0 size is clamped to maxValue. Default: 0.
member.returns: The optimal dimension under the given constraints.

Plane into which the geometry if flattened into.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Matrix.BuildTextureTransform(System.Single,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector2Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector2Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector2Df)
member.summary:
Set to a texture transformation matrix with the given parameters.
Generate texture coordinates as linear functions so that: u = Ux*x + Uy*y + Uz*z + Uw v = Vx*x + Vy*y + Vz*z + Vw The matrix M for this case is: Ux Vx 0 0 Uy Vy 0 0 Uz Vz 0 0 Uw Vw 0 0.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.Core.Plane3Df
member.summary:
Plane class with some intersection testing methods.
It has to be ensured, that the normal is always normalized. The constructors and setters of this class will not ensure this automatically. So any normal passed in has to be normalized in advance. No change to the normal will be made by any of the class methods.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Core.Plane3Df.D
member.summary: Distance from origin.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Plane3Df.GetDistanceTo(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df)
member.summary:
Get the distance to a point.
Note that this only works if the normal is normalized.
member.param: Target point.
member.returns: The distnace from point to this plane.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Plane3Df.GetIntersectionWithLimitedLine(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df@)
member.summary: Get an intersection with a 3d line, limited between two 3d points.
member.param: Point 1 of the line.
Point 2 of the line.
Place to store the intersection point, if there is one. Note: this output value has meaning only if this method returns true.
member.returns: True if there was an intersection, false if there was not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Plane3Df.GetIntersectionWithLine(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df@)
member.summary: Get an intersection with a 3d line (line defined by start point and direction, so actually this is a ray).
member.param: Point of the line to intersect with.
Vector of the line to intersect with.
Place to store the intersection point, if there is one. Note: this output value has meaning only if this method returns true.
member.returns: True if there was an intersection, false if there was not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Plane3Df.GetIntersectionWithPlane(IrrlichtLime.Core.Plane3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df@,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df@)
member.summary: Intersects this plane with another.
member.param: Other plane to intersect with.
Base point of intersection line.
Vector of intersection.
member.returns: True if there is a intersection, false if not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Plane3Df.GetIntersectionWithPlanes(IrrlichtLime.Core.Plane3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Plane3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df@)
member.summary: Get the intersection point with two other planes if there is one.
member.param: Other plane 1 to intersect with.
Other plane 2 to intersect with.
Intersection result.
member.returns: True if there is a intersection, false if not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Plane3Df.GetKnownIntersectionWithLine(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df)
member.summary:
Get percentage (value from 0.0 to 1.0) of line between two points where an intersection with this plane happens.
Only useful if known that there is an intersection.
member.param: Point1 of the line to intersect with.
Point2 of the line to intersect with.
member.returns: Where on a line between two points an intersection with this plane happened. For example, 0.5 is returned if the intersection happened exactly in the middle of the two points.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Plane3Df.Intersects(IrrlichtLime.Core.Plane3Df)
member.summary: Tests if there is an intersection with the other plane.
member.param: Other plane.
member.returns: True if there is an intersection.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Plane3Df.IsFrontFacing(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df)
member.summary:
Test if the triangle would be front or backfacing from any point.
Thus, this method assumes a camera position from which the triangle is definitely visible when looking into the given direction. Note that this only works if the normal is Normalized. Do not use this method with points as it will give wrong results!
member.param: Look direction.
member.returns: True if the plane is front facing and false if it is backfacing.

member.summary: Sets this quaternion to the result of the spherical interpolation between two quaternions.
member.param: First quaternion to be interpolated.
Second quaternion to be interpolated.
Progress of interpolation. For time=0 the result is q1, for time=1 the result is q2. Otherwise interpolation between q1 and q2.
member.returns: This quaternion.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Quaternion.Slerp(IrrlichtLime.Core.Quaternion,IrrlichtLime.Core.Quaternion,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets this quaternion to the result of the spherical interpolation between two quaternions.
member.param: First quaternion to be interpolated.
Second quaternion to be interpolated.
Progress of interpolation. For time=0 the result is q1, for time=1 the result is q2. Otherwise interpolation between q1 and q2.

To avoid inaccuracies at the end (time=1) the interpolation switches to linear interpolation at some point. This value defines how much of the remaining interpolation will be calculated with Lerp(). Everything from 1-threshold up will be linear interpolation. Default: 0.05f.
member.returns: This quaternion.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.Core.Rectd
member.summary:
Rectangular area.
Mostly used by 2D GUI elements and for 2D drawing methods. It has 2 positions instead of position and dimension and a fast method for collision detection with other rectangles and points.
Coordinates are (0,0) for top-left corner, and increasing to the right and to the bottom.

member.summary: Get the closest point on a triangle to a point on the same plane.
member.param: Point which must be on the same plane as the triangle.
member.returns: The closest point of the triangle.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Triangle3Df.GetIntersectionOfPlaneWithLine(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df@)
member.summary: Calculates the intersection between a 3d line (line defined by start point and direction, so actually this is a ray) and the plane the triangle is on.
member.param: Point of the line to intersect with.
Vector of the line to intersect with.
Place to store the intersection point, if there is one.
member.returns: True if there was an intersection, else false.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Triangle3Df.GetIntersectionWithLimitedLine(IrrlichtLime.Core.Line3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df@)
member.summary: Get an intersection with a 3d line.
member.param: Line to intersect with.
Place to store the intersection point, if there is one.
member.returns: True if there was an intersection, false if not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Triangle3Df.GetIntersectionWithLine(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df@)
member.summary:
Get an intersection with a 3d line.
Please note that also points are returned as intersection which are on the line, but not between the start and end point of the line. If you want the returned point be between start and end use GetIntersectionWithLimitedLine().
member.param: Point of the line to intersect with.
Vector of the line to intersect with.
Place to store the intersection point, if there is one.
member.returns: True if there was an intersection, false if there was not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Triangle3Df.IsFrontFacing(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df)
member.summary:
Test if the triangle would be front or backfacing from any point.
Thus, this method assumes a camera position from which the triangle is definitely visible when looking at the given direction. Do not use this method with points as it will give wrong results!
member.param: Look direction.
member.returns: True if the plane is front facing and false if it is backfacing.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Triangle3Df.IsPointInside(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df)
member.summary: Check if a point is inside the triangle (border-points count also as inside).
member.param: Point to test. Assumes that this point is already on the plane of the triangle.
member.returns: True if the point is inside the triangle, otherwise false.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Triangle3Df.IsPointInsideFast(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df)
member.summary:
Check if a point is inside the triangle (border-points count also as inside).
This method uses a barycentric coordinate system. It is faster than IsPointInside() but is more susceptible to floating point rounding errors. This will especially be noticable when the FPU is in single precision mode (which is for example set on default by Direct3D).
member.param: Point to test. Assumes that this point is already on the plane of the triangle.
member.returns: True if the point is inside the triangle, otherwise false.

member.summary: Determines if the triangle is totally inside a bounding box.
member.param: Box to check.
member.returns: True if triangle is within the box, otherwise false.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Triangle3Df.IsTotalOutsideBox(IrrlichtLime.Core.AABBox)
member.summary: Determines if the triangle is totally outside a bounding box.
member.param: Box to check.
member.returns: True if triangle is outside the box, otherwise false.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd
member.summary:
3d vector class with lots of operators and methods.
The Vector3D class is used in Irrlicht for three main purposes: 1) As a direction vector (most of the methods assume this). 2) As a position in 3d space (which is synonymous with a direction vector from the origin to this position). 3) To hold three Euler rotations, where X is pitch, Y is yaw and Z is roll.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd.CrossProduct(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd)
member.summary: Calculates the cross product with another vector.
member.param: Vector to multiply with.
member.returns: Cross product of this vector with other.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd.DotProduct(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd)
member.summary: Get the dot product with another vector.
member.param: Other vector.
member.returns: Dot product result.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd.EqualsTo(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd)
member.summary: Checks if this vector equals the other one, taking floating point rounding errors into account.
member.param: Other vector for comparision.
member.returns: True if vectors are equal.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd.EqualsTo(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd,System.Double)
member.summary: Checks if this vector equals the other one, taking floating point rounding errors into account.
member.param: Other vector for comparision.
Tolerance of comparision. Default: 0.000001f.
member.returns: True if vectors are equal.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd.GetDistanceFrom(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd)
member.summary:
Get distance from another point.
Here, the vector is interpreted as point in 3 dimensional space.
member.param: Other vector.
member.returns: Distance from the point.

member.summary:
Returns squared distance from another point.
Here, the vector is interpreted as point in 3 dimensional space.
member.param: Other vector.
member.returns: Squared distance.

member.summary: Creates an interpolated vector between this vector and another vector.
member.param: The other vector to interpolate with.
Interpolation value between 0.0f (all the other vector) and 1.0f (all this vector). Note that this is the opposite direction of interpolation to GetInterpolatedQuadratic().
member.returns: An interpolated vector. This vector is not modified.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd.GetInterpolatedQuadratic(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a quadratically interpolated vector between this and two other vectors.
member.param: Second vector to interpolate with.
Third vector to interpolate with (maximum at 1.0f)
Interpolation value between 0.0f (all this vector) and 1.0f (all the 3rd vector). Note that this is the opposite direction of interpolation to GetInterpolated() and Interpolate().
member.returns: An interpolated vector. This vector is not modified.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd.HorizontalAngle
member.summary:
The rotations that would make a (0,0,1) direction vector point in the same direction as this direction vector.
This property contains a rotation vector containing the X (pitch) and Y (raw) rotations (in degrees) that when applied to a +Z (e.g. 0, 0, 1) direction vector would make it point in the same direction as this vector. The Z (roll) rotation is always 0, since two Euler rotations are sufficient to point in any given direction.
Thanks to Arras on the Irrlicht forums for this method.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd.Interpolate(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Dd,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets this vector to the linearly interpolated vector between two other.
member.param: First vector to interpolate with, maximum at 1.0f.
Second vector to interpolate with, maximum at 0.0f.
Interpolation value between 0.0f (all vector other2) and 1.0f (all vector other1). Note that this is the opposite direction of interpolation to GetInterpolatedQuadratic().
member.returns: Reference to this vector after interpolation.

member.summary:
Builds a direction vector from (this) rotation vector.
This vector is assumed to be a rotation vector composed of 3 Euler angle rotations, in degrees. The implementation performs the same calculations as using a matrix to do the rotation.

member.param: The direction representing "forwards" which will be rotated by this vector. If you do not provide a direction, then the +Z axis (0, 0, 1) will be assumed to be forwards.
member.returns: A direction vector calculated by rotating the forwards direction by the 3 Euler angles (in degrees) represented by this vector.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df
member.summary:
3d vector class with lots of operators and methods.
The Vector3D class is used in Irrlicht for three main purposes: 1) As a direction vector (most of the methods assume this). 2) As a position in 3d space (which is synonymous with a direction vector from the origin to this position). 3) To hold three Euler rotations, where X is pitch, Y is yaw and Z is roll.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df.GetInterpolated(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an interpolated vector between this vector and another vector.
member.param: The other vector to interpolate with.
Interpolation value between 0.0f (all the other vector) and 1.0f (all this vector). Note that this is the opposite direction of interpolation to GetInterpolatedQuadratic().
member.returns: An interpolated vector. This vector is not modified.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df.GetInterpolatedQuadratic(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a quadratically interpolated vector between this and two other vectors.
member.param: Second vector to interpolate with.
Third vector to interpolate with (maximum at 1.0f)
Interpolation value between 0.0f (all this vector) and 1.0f (all the 3rd vector). Note that this is the opposite direction of interpolation to GetInterpolated() and Interpolate().
member.returns: An interpolated vector. This vector is not modified.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df.HorizontalAngle
member.summary:
The rotations that would make a (0,0,1) direction vector point in the same direction as this direction vector.
This property contains a rotation vector containing the X (pitch) and Y (raw) rotations (in degrees) that when applied to a +Z (e.g. 0, 0, 1) direction vector would make it point in the same direction as this vector. The Z (roll) rotation is always 0, since two Euler rotations are sufficient to point in any given direction.
Thanks to Arras on the Irrlicht forums for this method.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df.Interpolate(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets this vector to the linearly interpolated vector between two other.
member.param: First vector to interpolate with, maximum at 1.0f.
Second vector to interpolate with, maximum at 0.0f.
Interpolation value between 0.0f (all vector other2) and 1.0f (all vector other1). Note that this is the opposite direction of interpolation to GetInterpolatedQuadratic().
member.returns: Reference to this vector after interpolation.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df.Invert
member.summary: Inverts the vector.
member.returns: Reference to this vector after inversion.

It is assumed that the point is on the line.

Ending vector to compare between.
member.returns: True if this vector is between begin and end, false if not.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.GUI.CursorControl
member.summary: Mouse cursor manipulation.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.CursorControl.PlatformBehavior
member.summary: Platform specific behavior.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.CursorControl.Position
member.summary: Position of the mouse cursor.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.CursorControl.RelativePosition
member.summary: Returns the current position of the cursor. The returned position is a value between (0.0f, 0.0f) and (1.0f, 1.0f), where (0.0f, 0.0f) is the top left corner and (1.0f, 1.0f) is the bottom right corner of the render window. Use SetReferenceRect() to set custom rect.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.CursorControl.SetReferenceRect(IrrlichtLime.Core.Recti)
member.summary:
Sets an absolute reference rect for setting and retrieving the cursor position.
If this rect is set, the cursor position is not being calculated relative to the rendering window but to this rect. You can set the rect pointer to null to disable this feature again. This feature is useful when rendering into parts of foreign windows for example in an editor.
member.param: Reference rectangle or null to disable the reference rectangle.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.CursorControl.Visible
member.summary: True if the mouse cursor is visible, false if not.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.GUI.CursorPlatformBehavior
member.summary: Platform specific behavior flags for the cursor.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.CursorPlatformBehavior.None
member.summary: No platform specific behavior. This is default value.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.CursorPlatformBehavior.X11CacheUpdates
member.summary:
On X11 try caching cursor updates as XQueryPointer calls can be expensive.
Update cursor positions only when the irrlicht timer has been updated or the timer is stopped. This means you usually get one cursor update per device->run() which will be fine in most cases. See this forum-thread for a more detailed explanation: http://irrlicht.sourceforge.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=7&t=45525.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIAlignment.LowerRight
member.summary: Aligned to parent's bottom or right side.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIAlignment.Scale
member.summary: Stretched to fit parent.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIAlignment.UpperLeft
member.summary: Aligned to parent's top or left side. This is default value.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.ActiveFont
member.summary: The font which is used right now for drawing. Currently this is the override font when one is set and the font of the active skin otherwise.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.AutoScroll
member.summary: Automatic scrolling with cursor position. When "true" the text will move around with the cursor position.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.CursorBlinkTime
member.summary: The blink time for the cursor in milliseconds. 2x blink time is one full cycle. When set to 0 the cursor is constantly on without blinking.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.CursorChar
member.summary: The character used for the cursor. By default it's "_".

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.DrawBackground
member.summary: True if background drawing is enabled, false otherwise.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.DrawBorder
member.summary: True if border drawing is enabled, false otherwise.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.MaxLength
member.summary: The maximum amount of characters which may be entered in the box. If 0, the character amount is infinity.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.MultiLine
member.summary: Enables or disables newlines. If set to true, the GUIEventType.EditBoxEnter event will not be fired, instead a newline character will be inserted.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.OverrideColor
member.summary:
Another color for the text. If set, the edit box does not use the GUIDefaultColor.ButtonText color defined in the skin, but this color instead.
Note: setting this value will also set OverrideColorEnabled to true.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.OverrideColorEnabled
member.summary: If the text should use the override color or the color in the gui skin. If set to true, the override color, which can be set with OverrideColor is used, otherwise the GUIDefaultColor.ButtonText color of the skin.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.OverrideFont
member.summary: The override font or null if skin font is used.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.PasswordBox
member.summary: If the edit box is currently a password box. Setting to true will disable MultiLine, WordWrap and the ability to copy with Ctrl+C or Ctrl+X.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.SetPasswordChar(System.Char)
member.summary: Sets password char.
member.param: The character that is displayed instead of letters.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.SetTextAlignment(IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIAlignment,IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIAlignment)
member.summary: Sets text justification mode.
member.param: UpperLeft for left justified (default), LowerRight for right justified, or Center for centered text.
UpperLeft to align with top edge, LowerRight for bottom edge, or Center for centered text (default).

member.summary: The size of the text in pixels.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEditBox.WordWrap
member.summary: If set to true, words going over one line are broken to the next line.

member.summary:
True if element is enabled.
Note: currently elements do _not_ care about parent-states. So if you want to affect childs you have to enable/disable them all. The only exception to this are sub-elements which also check their parent.

member.summary: Finds the first element with the given id.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement.GetElementFromID(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds the first element with the given id.
member.param: Id to search for.
True, if also children of this element may contain the element with the searched id and they should be searched too. Default is false.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement.GetElementFromPoint(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector2Di)
member.summary:
Returns the topmost GUI element at the specific position.
This will check this GUI element and all of its descendants, so it may return this GUI element. To check all GUI elements, call this function on device.GUIEnvironment.RootElement. Note that the root element is the size of the screen, so doing so (with an on-screen point) will always return the root element if no other element is above it at that point.
member.param: The point at which to find a GUI element.
member.returns: The topmost GUI element at that point, or null if there are no candidate elements at that point.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement.GetNextElement(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement@,IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement@)
member.summary: Searches elements to find the closest next element to tab to.
member.param: The TabOrder of the current element, -1 if none.
True if searching for a lower number.
True if searching for a higher one.
Element with the highest/lowest known tab order depending on search direction.
The closest match, depending on tab order and direction.
member.returns: True if successfully found an element, false to continue searching/fail.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement.GetNextElement(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement@,IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches elements to find the closest next element to tab to.
member.param: The TabOrder of the current element, -1 if none.
True if searching for a lower number.
True if searching for a higher one.
Element with the highest/lowest known tab order depending on search direction.
The closest match, depending on tab order and direction.
Includes invisible elements in the search. Default is false.
member.returns: True if successfully found an element, false to continue searching/fail.

member.name: E:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement.OnEvent
member.summary:
Called if an event happened.
You should return true if you have handled the event, and false -- if not (in this case Irrlicht Engine will process it).

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement.OnEventEventHandler
member.summary:
Called if an event happened.
Please take care that you should only return 'true' when you want to _prevent_ Irrlicht from processing the event any further. So 'true' does mean that an event is completely done. Therefore your return value for all unprocessed events should be 'false'.
member.param: Event details.

member.param: The rectangle to set, interpreted as a proportion of the parent's area. Meaningful values are in the range [0...1], unless you intend this element to spill outside its parent.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement.SubElement
member.summary: True if this element was created as part of its parent control. For example, it is true when a scrollbar is part of a listbox. SubElements are not saved to disk when calling GUIEnvironment.SaveGUI().

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement.TabGroup
member.summary: Whether this element is a container for a group of elements which can be navigated using the tab key. For example, windows are tab groups. Groups can be navigated using Ctrl+Tab, providing its TabStop with true.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement.TabGroupElement
member.summary: The container element which holds all elements in this element's tab group.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement.TabOrder
member.summary: The priority of focus when using the tab key to navigate between a group of elements. Elements with a lower number are focused first.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement.TabStop
member.summary: If set to true, the focus will visit this element when using the tab key to cycle through elements. If this element is a TabGroup then Ctrl+Tab will be used instead.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEnvironment.AddEditBox(System.String,IrrlichtLime.Core.Recti)
member.summary:
Adds an edit box.
Supports unicode input from every keyboard around the world, scrolling, copying and pasting (exchanging data with the clipboard directly), maximum character amount, marking, and all shortcuts like Ctrl+X, Ctrl+V, Ctrl+C, Shift+Left, Shift+Right, Home, End, and so on.
member.param: Text to be displayed.
Rectangle specifying the borders of the element.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEnvironment.HoveredElement
member.summary:
The element which was last under the mouse cursor.
This information is updated _after_ the user-event receiver received it's mouse-events. To find the hovered element while catching mouse events you have to use instead: RootElement.GetElementFromPoint(mousePos);

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEnvironment.LoadGUI(IrrlichtLime.IO.ReadFile)
member.summary:
Loads the GUI. Note that the current GUI is not cleared before.
When a parent is set the elements will be added below the parent, the parent itself does not deserialize. When the file contains skin-settings from the GUI environment those are always serialized into the GUI environment independently of the parent setting.
member.param: The file to load from.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEnvironment.LoadGUI(IrrlichtLime.IO.ReadFile,IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIElement)

member.param: The file to load from.
Parent for the loaded GUI. Default is null.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.ButtonClicked
member.summary: A button was clicked.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.CheckBoxChanged
member.summary: A checkbox has changed its check state.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.ComboBoxChanged
member.summary: The selection in a combo box has been changed.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.EditBoxChanged
member.summary:
The text in an editbox was changed.
This does not include automatic changes in text-breaking.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.EditBoxEnter
member.summary: "Enter" was pressed in an editbox.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.EditBoxMarkingChanged
member.summary: The marked area in an editbox was changed.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.ElementClosed
member.summary:
An element would like to close.
Windows and context menus use this event when they would like to close, this can be cancelled by absorbing the event.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.ElementFocused
member.summary:
A GUI element has got the focus.
If the event is absorbed then the focus will not be changed.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.ElementFocusLost
member.summary:
A GUI element has lost its focus.
GUIEvent.Caller is losing the focus to GUIEvent.Element. If the event is absorbed then the focus will not be changed.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.ElementMouseHovered
member.summary:
The mouse cursor hovered over a GUI element.
If an element has sub-elements you also get this message for the sub-elements.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.ElementMouseLeft
member.summary:
The mouse cursor left the hovered element.
If an element has sub-elements you also get this message for the sub-elements.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.FileDialogCancelled
member.summary: A file open dialog has been closed without choosing a file.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.FileDialogDirectorySelected
member.summary: A directory has been selected in the file dialog.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.FileDialogFileSelected
member.summary: A file has been selected in the file dialog.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.ListBoxChanged
member.summary:
A new item in a listbox was selected.
You also get this event currently when the same item was clicked again after more than 500 ms.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.ListBoxSelectedAgain
member.summary:
An item in the listbox was selected, which was already selected.
You get the event currently only if the item was clicked again within 500 ms or selected by "Enter" or "Space".

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIEventType.MenuItemSelected

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIFont.GetKerningWidth(System.Char)
member.summary:
Gets kerning values (distance between letters) for the font.
Use KerningWidth property if you need global kerning distance.
member.param: The left side kerning for this letter is added to the global kerning value. For example, a space might only be one pixel wide, but it may be displayed as several pixels.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIFont.GetKerningWidth(System.Char,System.Char)
member.summary:
Gets kerning values (distance between letters) for the font.
Use KerningWidth property if you need global kerning distance.
member.param: The left side kerning for this letter is added to the global kerning value. For example, a space might only be one pixel wide, but it may be displayed as several pixels.

If not null, kerning is calculated for both letters and added to the global kerning value. For example, in a font which supports kerning pairs a string such as 'Wo' may have the 'o' tucked neatly under the 'W'. Default is null.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIFont.KerningHeight
member.summary: Global kerning height for the font.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIFont.KerningWidth
member.summary: Global kerning width for the font.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIFont.SetInvisibleCharacters(System.String)
member.summary:
Define which characters should not be drawn by the font.
For example " " would not draw any space which is usually blank in most fonts.
member.param: String of symbols which are not send down to the video driver.

member.summary: Element for fading out or in.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIInOutFader.FadeIn(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Starts the fade in process.
In the beginning the whole rect is drawn by the set color (black by default) and at the end of the overgiven time the color has faded out.
member.param: Time specifying how long it should need to fade in, in milliseconds.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIInOutFader.FadeOut(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Starts the fade out process.
In the beginning everything is visible, and at the end of the time only the set color (black by the fault) will be drawn.
member.param: Time specifying how long it should need to fade out, in milliseconds.

member.summary: True if the fade in or out process is done.

True to enable title drawing.
Color of the title bar.
Defining area where to draw.
Clip area. If null no clipping will be done. Default is null.

If you call this method with this argument, the method will not draw anything, but will instead return the client area which can be used for drawing by the calling window. That is the area without borders and without titlebar.
member.returns: Rect where it would be good to draw title bar text. This will work even when checkClientArea is set to a non-null value.

member.summary:
Another color for the text. If set, the static text does not use the GUIDefaultColor.ButtonText color defined in the skin, but this color instead.
Note: setting this value will also set OverrideColorEnabled to true.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIStaticText.OverrideColorEnabled
member.summary: If the text should use the override color or the color in the gui skin. If set to true, the override color, which can be set with OverrideColor is used, otherwise the GUIDefaultColor.ButtonText color of the skin.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIStaticText.OverrideFont
member.summary: The override font (if any). If this is set to null, the static text uses the font of the skin.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIStaticText.RightToLeft
member.summary:
Whether the string should be interpreted as right-to-left (RTL) text.
Note: this component does not implement the Unicode bidi standard, the text of the component should be already RTL if you call this. The main difference when RTL is enabled is that the linebreaks for multiline elements are performed starting from the end.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIStaticText.SetTextAlignment(IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIAlignment,IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIAlignment)
member.summary: Sets text justification mode.
member.param: UpperLeft for left justified (default), LowerRight for right justified, or Center for centered text.
UpperLeft to align with top edge, LowerRight for bottom edge, or Center for centered text (default).

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUITable.OrderRows
member.summary:
This tells the table to start ordering all the rows.
You need to explicitly tell the table to re order the rows when a new row is added or the cells data is changed. This makes the system more flexible and doesn't make you pay the cost of ordering when adding a lot of rows.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUITable.OrderRows(System.Int32)
member.summary:
This tells the table to start ordering all the rows.
You need to explicitly tell the table to re order the rows when a new row is added or the cells data is changed. This makes the system more flexible and doesn't make you pay the cost of ordering when adding a lot of rows.
member.param: Column index. If -1 then active column is used. Must be from -1 to ColumnCount-1. Default is -1.

member.summary:
Default tree view GUI element.
Displays a windows like tree buttons to expand/collaps the child nodes of an node and optional tree lines. Each node consits of a text, an icon text and a int value for user data.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIWindow
member.summary: Default moveable window GUI element with border, caption and close icons.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIWindow.ClientRect
member.summary:
The rectangle of the drawable area (without border and without titlebar).
The coordinates are given relative to the top-left position of the gui element. So to get absolute positions you have to add the resulting rectangle to AbsolutePosition.UpperLeftCorner. To get it relative to the parent element you have to add the resulting rectangle to RelativePosition.UpperLeftCorner. Beware that adding a menu will not change the ClientRect as menus are own gui elements, so in that case you might want to subtract the menu area additionally.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIWindow.CloseButton
member.summary: The Close button. You can hide the button by calling "CloseButton.Visible = false;".

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIWindow.Draggable
member.summary: True if the window can be dragged with the mouse, false if not.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIWindow.DrawBackground
member.summary: True if the window background will be drawn.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIWindow.DrawTitleBar
member.summary: True if the window titlebar will be drawn. Note: If the background is not drawn, then the titlebar is automatically also not drawn.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIWindow.MaximizeButton
member.summary: The Maximize button. You can hide the button by calling "MaximizeButton.Visible = false;".

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.GUI.GUIWindow.MinimizeButton
member.summary: The Minimize button. You can hide the button by calling "MinimizeButton.Visible = false;".

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.IO.ArchiveLoader
member.summary:
Class which is able to create an archive from a file.
If you want the Irrlicht Engine be able to load archives of currently unsupported file formats (e.g. ".wad"), then implement this and add your new archive loader with FileSystem.AddArchiveLoader() to the engine.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.ArchiveLoader.CreateArchive(IrrlichtLime.IO.ReadFile,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an archive from given file.
member.param: File to use.
Searching is performed without regarding the case.
Files are searched without checking for the directories.
member.returns: Pointer to newly created archive, or null upon error.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.ArchiveLoader.CreateArchive(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an archive from given filename.
member.param: File to use.
Searching is performed without regarding the case.
Files are searched without checking for the directories.
member.returns: Pointer to newly created archive, or null upon error.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.ArchiveLoader.IsALoadableFileFormat(IrrlichtLime.IO.ReadFile)
member.summary: Checks if the file might be loaded by this loader. Check may look into the file content.
member.param: File to check.
member.returns: True if file seems to be loadable.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.ArchiveLoader.IsALoadableFileFormat(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the file might be loaded by this loader. Check based on the file extension (e.g. ".zip").
member.param: Name of file to check.
member.returns: True if file seems to be loadable.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.ArchiveLoader.IsALoadableFileFormat(IrrlichtLime.IO.FileArchiveType)
member.summary: Checks if the loader can create archives of given type.
member.param: Archive type to check.
member.returns: True if the archive loader supports this type, false if not.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.IO.Attributes.MaxByteArraySize
member.summary:
Maximum bytes that can be read by GetValue() for ByteArray attributes.
Indeed, you can Add/SetValue() with more than this value of bytes, this value used only by GetValue() when internally allocating temporary low level buffer (and only with ByteArray attribute type).
Default: 65536.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.IO.FileSystem
member.summary:
Manages files and archives and provides access to them.
This class manages where files are, so that modules which use the the IO do not need to know where every file is located. A file could be in a ZIP archive or as file on disk, using the FileSystem makes no difference to this.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.FileSystem.AddArchiveLoader(IrrlichtLime.IO.ArchiveLoader)
member.summary:
Adds an external archive loader to the engine.
Use this function to add support for new archive types to the engine, for example proprietary or encrypted file storage.
member.param: Archive loader to add.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.FileSystem.AddFileArchive(IrrlichtLime.IO.FileArchive)
member.summary: Adds an archive to the file system.
member.param: The archive to add to the file system.
member.returns: True if the archive was added successfully, false if not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.FileSystem.AddFileArchive(IrrlichtLime.IO.ReadFile)
member.summary:
Adds an archive to the file system.
After calling this, the Irrlicht Engine will also search and open files directly from this archive. This is useful for hiding data from the end user, speeding up file access and making it possible to access for example Quake3 .pk3 files, which are just renamed .zip files. Irrlicht supports AES-encrypted zip files, and the advanced compression techniques lzma and bzip2.
member.param: Archive to add to the file system.
member.returns: True if the archive was added successfully, false if not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.FileSystem.AddFileArchive(IrrlichtLime.IO.ReadFile,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Adds an archive to the file system.
After calling this, the Irrlicht Engine will also search and open files directly from this archive. This is useful for hiding data from the end user, speeding up file access and making it possible to access for example Quake3 .pk3 files, which are just renamed .zip files. Irrlicht supports AES-encrypted zip files, and the advanced compression techniques lzma and bzip2.
member.param: Archive to add to the file system.
If set to true, files in the archive can be accessed without writing all letters in the right case. Default: true.
member.returns: True if the archive was added successfully, false if not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.FileSystem.AddFileArchive(IrrlichtLime.IO.ReadFile,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

Irrlicht supports AES-encrypted zip files, and the advanced compression techniques lzma and bzip2.
member.param: Archive to add to the file system.
If set to true, files in the archive can be accessed without writing all letters in the right case. Default: true.
If set to true, files in the added archive can be accessed without its complete path. Default: true.
member.returns: True if the archive was added successfully, false if not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.FileSystem.AddFileArchive(IrrlichtLime.IO.ReadFile,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,IrrlichtLime.IO.FileArchiveType)
member.summary:
Adds an archive to the file system.
After calling this, the Irrlicht Engine will also search and open files directly from this archive. This is useful for hiding data from the end user, speeding up file access and making it possible to access for example Quake3 .pk3 files, which are just renamed .zip files. Irrlicht supports AES-encrypted zip files, and the advanced compression techniques lzma and bzip2.
member.param: Archive to add to the file system.
If set to true, files in the archive can be accessed without writing all letters in the right case. Default: true.
If set to true, files in the added archive can be accessed without its complete path. Default: true.

If no specific FileArchiveType is selected then the type of archive will depend on the extension of the file name. If you use a different extension then you can use this parameter to force a specific type of archive. Default: FileArchiveType.Unknown.
member.returns: True if the archive was added successfully, false if not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.FileSystem.AddFileArchive(IrrlichtLime.IO.ReadFile,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,IrrlichtLime.IO.FileArchiveType,System.String)

member.param: Archive to add to the file system.
If set to true, files in the archive can be accessed without writing all letters in the right case. Default: true.

member.returns: True if the archive was added successfully, false if not.

member.summary:
Adds an archive to the file system.
After calling this, the Irrlicht Engine will also search and open files directly from this archive. This is useful for hiding data from the end user, speeding up file access and making it possible to access for example Quake3 .pk3 files, which are just renamed .zip files. Newly added archive, if adding was successful.
member.returns: True if the archive was added successfully, false if not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.FileSystem.AddFileArchive(System.String)
member.summary:
Adds an archive to the file system.
After calling this, the Irrlicht Engine will also search and open files directly from this archive. This is useful for hiding data from the end user, speeding up file access and making it possible to access for example Quake3 .pk3 files, which are just renamed .zip files. Irrlicht supports AES-encrypted zip files, and the advanced compression techniques lzma and bzip2.
If you want to add a directory as an archive, prefix its name with a slash in order to let Irrlicht recognize it as a folder mount (mypath/). Using this technique one can build up a search order, because archives are read first, and can be used more easily with relative filenames.
member.param: Filename of the archive to add to the file system.
member.returns: True if the archive was added successfully, false if not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.FileSystem.RemoveFileArchive(IrrlichtLime.IO.FileArchive)
member.summary:
Removes an archive from the file system.
This will close the archive and free any file handles, but will not close resources which have already been loaded and are now cached, for example textures and meshes.
member.param: The archive to remove.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.FileSystem.RemoveFileArchive(System.String)
member.summary:
Removes an archive from the file system.
This will close the archive and free any file handles, but will not close resources which have already been loaded and are now cached, for example textures and meshes. Note that a relative filename might be interpreted differently on each call, depending on the current working directory. In case you want to remove an archive that was added using a relative path name, you have to change to the same working directory again. This means, that the filename given on creation is not an identifier for the archive, but just a usual filename that is used for locating the archive to work with.
member.param: The archive of the given name will be removed.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.IO.FileSystem.RemoveFileArchive(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Removes an archive from the file system.
This will close the archive and free any file handles, but will not close resources which have already been loaded and are now cached, for example textures and meshes.
member.param: The index of the archive to remove.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.param: Frame number as zero-based index. Must be from 0 to FrameCount-1.
Level of detail. 0 is the lowest, 255 the highest level of detail. Most meshes will ignore this value. Default is 255.

Because some animated meshes (.MD2) are blended between 2 static frames, and maybe animated in a loop, the startFrameLoop and the endFrameLoop have to be defined, to prevent the animation to be blended between frames which are outside of this loop. If startFrameLoop and endFrameLoop are both -1, they are ignored. Default is -1.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Scene.AnimatedMesh.GetMesh(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets mesh for a frame.
member.param: Frame number as zero-based index. Must be from 0 to FrameCount-1.
Level of detail. 0 is the lowest, 255 the highest level of detail. Most meshes will ignore this value. Default is 255.

Because some animated meshes (.MD2) are blended between 2 static frames, and maybe animated in a loop, the startFrameLoop and the endFrameLoop have to be defined, to prevent the animation to be blended between frames which are outside of this loop. If startFrameLoop and endFrameLoop are both -1, they are ignored. Default is -1.

Because some animated meshes (.MD2) are blended between 2 static frames, and maybe animated in a loop, the startFrameLoop and the endFrameLoop have to be defined, to prevent the animation to be blended between frames which are outside of this loop.
