member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.AddRenderTargetTexture(IrrlichtLime.Core.Dimension2Di)
member.summary: Adds a new render target texture to the texture cache.
member.param: Size of the texture, in pixels. Width and height should be a power of two (e.g. 64, 128, 256, 512, ...) and it should not be bigger than the backbuffer, because it shares the zbuffer with the screen buffer.
member.returns: Pointer to the created texture or null if the texture could not be created.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.AddRenderTargetTexture(IrrlichtLime.Core.Dimension2Di,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new render target texture to the texture cache.
member.param: Size of the texture, in pixels. Width and height should be a power of two (e.g. 64, 128, 256, 512, ...) and it should not be bigger than the backbuffer, because it shares the zbuffer with the screen buffer.
An optional name for the RTT. Default: "rt".
member.returns: Pointer to the created texture or null if the texture could not be created.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.AddRenderTargetTexture(IrrlichtLime.Core.Dimension2Di,System.String,IrrlichtLime.Video.ColorFormat)
member.summary: Adds a new render target texture to the texture cache.
member.param: Size of the texture, in pixels. Width and height should be a power of two (e.g. 64, 128, 256, 512, ...) and it should not be bigger than the backbuffer, because it shares the zbuffer with the screen buffer.
An optional name for the RTT. Default: "rt".
The color format of the render target. Floating point formats are supported. Default: ColorFormat.Unknown.
member.returns: Pointer to the created texture or null if the texture could not be created.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.Attributes
member.summary:
Attributes of the actual video driver.
The following names can be queried for the given types: MaxTextures (int) The maximum number of simultaneous textures supported by the driver. This can be less than the supported number of textures of the driver. MaxSupportedTextures (int) The maximum number of simultaneous textures supported by the fixed function pipeline of the (hw) driver. The actual supported number of textures supported by the engine can be lower. MaxLights (int) Number of hardware lights supported in the fixed function pipieline of the driver, typically 6-8. Use light manager or deferred shading for more. MaxAnisotropy (int) Number of anisotropy levels supported for filtering. At least 1, max is typically at 16 or 32. MaxUserClipPlanes (int) Number of additional clip planes, which can be set by the user via dedicated driver methods. MaxAuxBuffers (int) Special render buffers, which are currently not really usable inside Irrlicht. Only supported by OpenGL. MaxMultipleRenderTargets (int) Number of render targets which can be bound simultaneously. Rendering to MRTs is done via shaders. MaxIndices (int) Number of indices which can be used in one render call (i.e. one mesh buffer). MaxTextureSize (int) Dimension that a texture may have, both in width and height. MaxGeometryVerticesOut (int) Number of vertices the geometry shader can output in one pass. Only OpenGL so far. MaxTextureLODBias (float) Maximum value for LOD bias. Is usually at around 16, but can be lower on some systems. Version (int) Version of the driver. Formatted as Major*100+Minor. ShaderLanguageVersion (int) Version of the high level shader language. Formatted as Major*100+Minor. AntiAlias (int) Number of samples the driver uses for each pixel. 0 and 1 means anti aliasing is off, typical values are 2,4,8,16,32.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.BeginScene
member.summary:
Applications must call this method before performing any rendering.
This method can clear the back- and the z-buffer.
member.returns: False if failed.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.BeginScene(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Applications must call this method before performing any rendering.
This method can clear the back- and the z-buffer.
member.param: Specifies if the back buffer should be cleared, which means that the screen is filled with the color specified. If this parameter is false, the back buffer will not be cleared and the color parameter is ignored. Default: true.
member.returns: False if failed.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.BeginScene(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Applications must call this method before performing any rendering.
This method can clear the back- and the z-buffer.
member.param: Specifies if the back buffer should be cleared, which means that the screen is filled with the color specified. If this parameter is false, the back buffer will not be cleared and the color parameter is ignored. Default: true.
Specifies if the depth buffer (z-buffer) should be cleared. It is not nesesarry to do so if only 2d drawing is used. Default: true.
member.returns: False if failed.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.BeginScene(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,IrrlichtLime.Video.Color)
member.summary:
Applications must call this method before performing any rendering.
This method can clear the back- and the z-buffer.
member.param: Specifies if the back buffer should be cleared, which means that the screen is filled with the color specified. If this parameter is false, the back buffer will not be cleared and the color parameter is ignored. Default: true.
Specifies if the depth buffer (z-buffer) should be cleared. It is not nesesarry to do so if only 2d drawing is used. Default: true.
The color used for back buffer clearing. Default: 0xff000000 (black opaque color).
member.returns: False if failed.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.BeginScene(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,IrrlichtLime.Video.Color,IrrlichtLime.Video.ExposedVideoData)
member.summary:
Applications must call this method before performing any rendering.
This method can clear the back- and the z-buffer.
member.param: Specifies if the back buffer should be cleared, which means that the screen is filled with the color specified. If this parameter is false, the back buffer will not be cleared and the color parameter is ignored. Default: true.
Specifies if the depth buffer (z-buffer) should be cleared. It is not nesesarry to do so if only 2d drawing is used. Default: true.
The color used for back buffer clearing. Default: 0xff000000 (black opaque color).

Handle of another window, if you want the bitmap to be displayed on another window. If this is an empty element, everything will be displayed in the default window. Note: This feature is not fully implemented for all devices. Default: new ExposedVideoData().
member.returns: False if failed.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.BeginScene(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,IrrlichtLime.Video.Color,IrrlichtLime.Video.ExposedVideoData,IrrlichtLime.Core.Recti)
member.summary:
Applications must call this method before performing any rendering.
This method can clear the back- and the z-buffer.
member.param: Specifies if the back buffer should be cleared, which means that the screen is filled with the color specified. If this parameter is false, the back buffer will not be cleared and the color parameter is ignored. Default: true.
Specifies if the depth buffer (z-buffer) should be cleared. It is not nesesarry to do so if only 2d drawing is used. Default: true.
The color used for back buffer clearing. Default: 0xff000000 (black opaque color).

Handle of another window, if you want the bitmap to be displayed on another window. If this is an empty element, everything will be displayed in the default window. Note: this feature is not fully implemented for all devices.
Rectangle defining the source rectangle of the area to be presented. Note: not implemented for all devices.
member.returns: False if failed.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.CheckDriverReset
member.summary:
Check if the driver was recently reset.
For D3D devices you will need to recreate the RTTs if the driver was reset. Should be queried right after BeginScene().
member.returns: True if driver was recently reset.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.ClearZBuffer
member.summary:
Clears the z-buffer.
Note that you usually need not to call this method, as it is automatically done in BeginScene() or SetRenderTarget() if you enable z-buffer. But if you have to render some special things, you can clear the zbuffer during the rendering process with this method any time.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.CreateImage(IrrlichtLime.IO.ReadFile)
member.summary:
Creates a software image from a file.
No hardware texture will be created for this image. This method is useful for example if you want to read a heightmap for a terrain renderer.
member.param: File from which the image is created.
member.returns: Created image. If you no longer need the image, you should call Image.Drop().

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.CreateImage(System.String)

member.param: Name of the file from which the image is created.
member.returns: Created image. If you no longer need the image, you should call Image.Drop().

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.Draw2DImageBatch(IrrlichtLime.Video.Texture,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector2Di,System.Collections.Generic.List{IrrlichtLime.Core.Recti},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary:
Draws a set of 2d images, using a color and the alpha channel of the texture.
The images are drawn beginning at given position and concatenated in one line. All drawings are clipped against clipRect (if its specified). The subtextures are defined by the list of sourceRects and are chosen by the indices given.
member.param: Texture to be drawn.
Upper left 2d destination position where the image will be drawn.
Source rectangles of the image.
List of indices which choose the actual rectangle used each time.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.Draw2DImageBatch(IrrlichtLime.Video.Texture,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector2Di,System.Collections.Generic.List{IrrlichtLime.Core.Recti},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Int32,IrrlichtLime.Core.Recti,IrrlichtLime.Video.Color)
member.summary:
Draws a set of 2d images, using a color and the alpha channel of the texture.
The images are drawn beginning at given position and concatenated in one line. All drawings are clipped against clipRect (if its specified). The subtextures are defined by the list of sourceRects and are chosen by the indices given.
member.param: Texture to be drawn.
Upper left 2d destination position where the image will be drawn.
Source rectangles of the image.
List of indices which choose the actual rectangle used each time.
Offset of each next position on X. Default: 0.
Rectangle on the screen where the image is clipped to. Default: null.
Color with which the image is drawn. Note that the alpha component is used. If alpha is other than 255, the image will be transparent. Default: opaque white.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.Draw2DPolygon(IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector2Di,System.Single,IrrlichtLime.Video.Color,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Draws a non filled concyclic regular 2d polygon.
This method can be used to draw circles, but also triangles, tetragons, pentagons, hexagons, heptagons, octagons, enneagons, decagons, hendecagons, dodecagon, triskaidecagons, etc. I think you'll got it now. And all this by simply specifying the vertex count. Welcome to the wonders of geometry.
member.param: Position of center of the polygon.
Radius of the polygon.
Color of the polygon.
Amount of vertices of the polygon. Specify 2 to draw a line, 3 to draw a triangle, 4 for tetragons and a lot (>10) for nearly a circle.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.Draw2DPolygon(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,IrrlichtLime.Video.Color,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Draws a non filled concyclic regular 2d polygon.
This method can be used to draw circles, but also triangles, tetragons, pentagons, hexagons, heptagons, octagons, enneagons, decagons, hendecagons, dodecagon, triskaidecagons, etc. I think you'll got it now. And all this by simply specifying the vertex count. Welcome to the wonders of geometry.
member.param: X position of center of the polygon.
Y position of center of the polygon.
Radius of the polygon.
Color of the polygon.
Amount of vertices of the polygon. Specify 2 to draw a line, 3 to draw a triangle, 4 for tetragons and a lot (>10) for nearly a circle.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.Draw2DVertexPrimitiveList(IrrlichtLime.Video.Vertex3D[],System.UInt16[])
member.summary:
Draws a vertex primitive list in 2d.
Compared to the general (3d) version of this method, this one sets up a 2d render mode, and uses only X and Y of vectors. Please note that currently not all primitives are available for all drivers, and some might be emulated via triangle renders.
This method is not available for the software drivers.
member.param: List of vertices.
List of 16-bit indices.

This method is not available for the software drivers.
member.param: List of vertices.
List of 16-bit indices.
Type of primitives to draw. Default: PrimitiveType.Triangles.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.DrawStencilShadow
member.summary:
Fills the stencil shadow with a color.
After the shadow volume has been drawn into the stencil buffer using DrawStencilShadowVolume(), use this to draw the color of the shadow.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.DrawStencilShadow(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Fills the stencil shadow with a color.
After the shadow volume has been drawn into the stencil buffer using DrawStencilShadowVolume(), use this to draw the color of the shadow.
member.param: True, if you want to paint every shadow with its own color. False, if you want to draw every shadow with the same color, and only want to call DrawStencilShadow() once after all shadow volumes have been drawn. Default: false.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.DrawStencilShadow(System.Boolean,IrrlichtLime.Video.Color)
member.summary:
Fills the stencil shadow with a color.
After the shadow volume has been drawn into the stencil buffer using DrawStencilShadowVolume(), use this to draw the color of the shadow.
member.param: True, if you want to paint every shadow with its own color. False, if you want to draw every shadow with the same color, and only want to call DrawStencilShadow() once after all shadow volumes have been drawn. Default: false.
Color of the shadow. Default: opaque black.

member.summary:
Fills the stencil shadow with a color.

Color of the shadow in the upper left corner of screen. Default: opaque black.
Color of the shadow in the upper right corner of screen. Default: opaque black.
Color of the shadow in the lower left corner of screen. Default: opaque black.
Color of the shadow in the lower right corner of screen. Default: opaque black.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.DrawStencilShadowVolume(System.Collections.Generic.List{IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df})
member.summary:
Draws a shadow volume into the stencil buffer.
To draw a stencil shadow, do next: draw all geometry, then use this method, to draw the shadow volume, then, use DrawStencilShadow() to visualize the shadow.
member.param: List of triangles specifying the shadow volume. Note: count of vectors in this list must be multiple to 3.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.DrawStencilShadowVolume(System.Collections.Generic.List{IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Draws a shadow volume into the stencil buffer.
To draw a stencil shadow, do next: draw all geometry, then use this method, to draw the shadow volume, then, use DrawStencilShadow() to visualize the shadow.
member.param: List of triangles specifying the shadow volume. Note: count of vectors in this list must be multiple to 3.
True to use Z-fail method, otherwise Z-pass will be used. Default: true.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.DrawStencilShadowVolume(System.Collections.Generic.List{IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector3Df},System.Boolean,IrrlichtLime.Scene.DebugSceneType)
member.summary:
Draws a shadow volume into the stencil buffer.
To draw a stencil shadow, do next: draw all geometry, then use this method, to draw the shadow volume, then, use DrawStencilShadow() to visualize the shadow.
member.param: List of triangles specifying the shadow volume. Note: count of vectors in this list must be multiple to 3.
True to use Z-fail method, otherwise Z-pass will be used. Default: true.
The debug data that is enabled for this shadow volume.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.FPS
member.summary:
Current frames per second value.
This value is updated approximately every 1.5 seconds and is only intended to provide a rough guide to the average frame rate. It is not suitable for use in performing timing calculations or framerate independent movement.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.GetMaterialRendererName(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Gets name of a material renderer.
This string can be used to test if a specific renderer already has been registered/created, or use this string to store data about materials. This returned name also used internally when serializing materials.
member.param: Index of the material. Must be from 0 to MaterialRendererCount-1.
member.returns: Name of the material renderer or null if not found.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.GetMaterialRendererName(IrrlichtLime.Video.MaterialType)
member.summary:
Gets name of a material renderer.
This string can be used to test if a specific renderer already has been registered/created, or use this string to store data about materials. This returned name also used internally when serializing materials.
member.param: Type of the material.
member.returns: Name of the material renderer or null if not found.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.GetOcclusionQueryResult(IrrlichtLime.Scene.SceneNode)
member.summary:
Gets occlusion query result.
Returns value which is the number of visible pixels/fragments. The value is a safe approximation, i.e. can be larger than the actual value of pixels.
member.param: Scene node.
member.returns: Number of visible pixels/fragments of the node.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.GetTexture(IrrlichtLime.IO.ReadFile)
member.summary:
Gets access to a named texture.
Loads the texture from disk if it is not already loaded and generates mipmap levels if desired. Texture loading can be influenced using the SetTextureCreationFlag() method. The texture can be in several imageformats, such as BMP, JPG, TGA, PCX, PNG, and PSD.
member.param: Pointer to an already opened file.
member.returns: Pointer to the texture, or null if the texture could not be loaded.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.GetTexture(System.String)
member.summary:
Gets access to a named texture.
Loads the texture from disk if it is not already loaded and generates mipmap levels if desired. Texture loading can be influenced using the SetTextureCreationFlag() method. The texture can be in several imageformats, such as BMP, JPG, TGA, PCX, PNG, and PSD.
member.param: Filename of the texture to be loaded.
member.returns: Pointer to the texture, or null if the texture could not be loaded.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.GetTexture(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Gets access to a named texture.
Loads the texture from disk if it is not already loaded and generates mipmap levels if desired. Texture loading can be influenced using the SetTextureCreationFlag() method. The texture can be in several imageformats, such as BMP, JPG, TGA, PCX, PNG, and PSD.
member.param: Index of the texture. Must be from 0 to TextureCount-1. Please note that this index might change when adding or removing textures.
member.returns: Pointer to the texture.

member.summary:
Returns if a texture creation flag is enabled or disabled.
You can change this value using SetTextureCreationFlag().

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.ImageLoaderCount
member.summary: The number of image loaders.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.MakeColorKeyTexture(IrrlichtLime.Video.Texture,IrrlichtLime.Video.Color)
member.summary:
Sets a boolean alpha channel on the texture based on the color at a position.
This makes the texture fully transparent at the texels where the color key can be found when using for example Draw2DImage with enabled useAlphaChannel parameter. The alpha of other texels is not modified.
member.param: Texture whose alpha channel is modified.

Key color. Every texel with this color will become fully transparent. Please note that the colors of a texture may be converted when loading it, so the color values may not be exactly the same in the engine and for example in picture edit programs. To avoid this problem, you could use the MakeColorKeyTexture method, which takes the position of a pixel instead a color value.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.MakeColorKeyTexture(IrrlichtLime.Video.Texture,IrrlichtLime.Core.Vector2Di)
member.summary:
Sets a boolean alpha channel on the texture based on the color at a position.
This makes the texture fully transparent at the texels where the color key can be found when using for example Draw2DImage with enabled useAlphaChannel parameter. The alpha of other texels is not modified.
member.param: Texture whose alpha channel is modified.
Position of a pixel with the key color.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.MakeNormalMapTexture(IrrlichtLime.Video.Texture)
member.summary:
Creates a normal map from a height map texture.
If the target texture has 32 bit, the height value is stored in the alpha component of the texture as addition. This value is used by the MaterialType.ParallaxMapSolid material and similar materials.
member.param: Texture whose alpha channel is modified

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.MakeNormalMapTexture(IrrlichtLime.Video.Texture,System.Single)
member.summary:
Creates a normal map from a height map texture.
If the target texture has 32 bit, the height value is stored in the alpha component of the texture as addition. This value is used by the MaterialType.ParallaxMapSolid material and similar materials.
member.param: Texture whose alpha channel is modified
Constant value by which the height information is multiplied. Default: 1.0f.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.Material2D
member.summary:
Current 2d material override.
This material allows to alter certain render states of the 2d methods. Not all members of Material are honored, especially not MaterialType and Textures. Moreover, the zbuffer is always ignored, and lighting is always off. All other flags can be changed, though some might have to effect in most cases. Please note that you have to enable/disable this effect with EnableMaterial2D(). This effect is costly, as it increases the number of state changes considerably. Always reset the values when done.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.RemoveAllTextures
member.summary:
Removes all textures from the texture cache and deletes them.
This method can free a lot of memory! Please note that after calling this, the pointer to the Texture may no longer be valid, if it was not grabbed before by other parts of the engine for storing it longer. So it is a good idea to set all materials which are using this texture to null or another texture first.

member.summary: Removes hardware buffer.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.RemoveTexture(IrrlichtLime.Video.Texture)
member.summary:
Removes a texture from the texture cache and deletes it.
This method can free a lot of memory! Please note that after calling this, the pointer to the Texture may no longer be valid, if it was not grabbed before by other parts of the engine for storing it longer. So it is a good idea to set all materials which are using this texture to null or another texture first.
member.param: Texture to delete from the engine cache.

New name for the texture. This should be a unique name.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.SetRenderTarget(IrrlichtLime.Video.Texture)
member.summary:
Sets a new render target.
This will only work if the driver supports the VideoDriverFeature.RenderToTarget feature, which can be queried with QueryFeature().
Please note that you cannot render 3d or 2d geometry with a render target as texture on it when you are rendering the scene into this render target at the same time. It is usually only possible to render into a texture between the BeginScene() and EndScene() method calls.
member.param: New render target. Must be a texture created with AddRenderTargetTexture(). If set to null, it sets the previous render target which was set before the last SetRenderTarget() call.
member.returns: True if sucessful and false if not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.SetRenderTarget(IrrlichtLime.Video.Texture,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets a new render target.
This will only work if the driver supports the VideoDriverFeature.RenderToTarget feature, which can be queried with QueryFeature().
Please note that you cannot render 3d or 2d geometry with a render target as texture on it when you are rendering the scene into this render target at the same time. It is usually only possible to render into a texture between the BeginScene() and EndScene() method calls.
member.param: New render target. Must be a texture created with AddRenderTargetTexture(). If set to null, it sets the previous render target which was set before the last SetRenderTarget() call.
True for clearing the back buffer with the color parameter. Default: true.
member.returns: True if sucessful and false if not.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoDriver.SetTextureCreationFlag(IrrlichtLime.Video.TextureCreationFlag,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Enables or disables a texture creation flag.
These flags define how textures should be created. By changing this value, you can influence for example the speed of rendering a lot. But please note that the video drivers take this value only as recommendation. It could happen that you enable the TextureCreationFlag.Always16Bit mode, but the driver still creates 32-bit textures.
member.param: Texture creation flag to set.
Specifies if the given flag should be enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoMode.Wide
member.summary:
Widescreen resolution.
Please note: widescreen resolution is a resolution which aspect ratio greater than 1.37.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoModeAspectRatio
member.summary: Enumeration for video mode aspect ratios.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoModeAspectRatio._3x2
member.summary:
3:2 aspect ratio. Ratio: 3/2 == 1.5.
Common screen resolutions: 960x640, 1152x768, 1440x960.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoModeAspectRatio._5x3
member.summary:
5:3 aspect ratio. Ratio: 5/3 == 1.(6) ~ 1.667.
Common screen resolutions: 400x240, 800x480, 1280x768.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoModeAspectRatio._5x4
member.summary:
5:4 aspect ratio. Ratio: 5/4 == 1.25.
Common screen resolutions: 600x480, 640x512, 1280x1024, 1800x1440, 2560x2048.

member.name: F:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoModeAspectRatio.Other
member.summary: Other aspect ratio which not listed in this enumeration.

member.name: T:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoModeList
member.summary:
List of all available video modes.
You can get a list via IrrlichtDevice.VideoModeList. There is no need to start up an Irrlicht Device with Direct3D8, OpenGL or even Software renderer: for this (and for lots of other reasons) the Null device exists.

member.name: P:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoModeList.Desktop
member.summary: Current desktop video mode.

member.name: M:IrrlichtLime.Video.VideoModeList.GetResolution(IrrlichtLime.Core.Dimension2Di,IrrlichtLime.Core.Dimension2Di)
member.summary: Gets a supported screen size with certain constraints.
member.param: Minimum dimensions required.
Maximum dimensions allowed.
member.returns: Size of screen in pixels which matches the requirements, as good as possible.
